Key Arguments: The bill would negatively impact freedom of speech, thought, and debate on digital platforms.
Critical thinking is a fundamental component of the Australian education system and should be promoted rather than restricted.
The bill implies a lack of trust in Australian citizens' ability to disseminate information and undermines the education system's objectives.
A punitive approach to misinformation is contrary to Australian values, which favor education and awareness over censorship.
The dynamic nature of information makes it difficult to define and regulate misinformation accurately.
Notable Quotes: I strongly oppose the Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) Bill 2023 because the attempt to curtail and control freedom of speech, thought and debate on digital platforms will deny Australian citizens the opportunity to freely engage in, and to develop their critical thinking skills.
You cannot teach others to think critically without allowing them to undergo a process of examination of information, both that which is credible and that which may be misleading.
